channel.title: Blogs on Brandon Liang
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Brandon Liang

item.title: No Distractions
item.description: Spotify No Longer Keeps Me Up I always stay up way too late (even after getting work done) usually because I’m hooked on Spotify. So I wrote a script and cron job to close Spotify automatically and scold me every night at 1:30 AM, 2:30 AM, and 3:30 AM! This is my computer systems knowledge coming to play! killall will send the SIGTERM signal to all Spotify processes running at the time, giving Spotify time to clean up so that essential operations can finish before shutting down.

item.title: << System Announcement >>
item.description: Welcome to my world. My name is Akihiko Kayaba. And as of this moment, I am in control of this world. I’m sure most of you have already noticed an item missing from your main menus: the logout button. Let me ensure you, this is not a defect in the game. I repeat… This is not a defect, this is how Sword Art Online was designed to be. You cannot log yourselves out of SAO.

item.title: Returning to Yu-Gi-Oh
item.description: Last modified on: 2022-08-22 I got back into Yu-Gi-Oh! recently with the iOS release of Master Duel and have built three different decks for competitive play. The highest tier I’ve made it to as of this writing is Platinum I (after Diamond rank update). Swordsoul Tenyi TODO D/D/D “D/D/D” stands for Different Dimension Daemon. Taste the power of demon kings that have conquered different dimensions. It’s an incredibly hard deck to master, and I still am in the process of doing so.

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2022
item.description: Co-op Duels: 2022 Last modified on: 2023-01-21 Read the 2021 prequel [here] Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, here’s how it went during my junior year. I interned as a software engineer at Snowflake in Boston working on diagnostics reporting, followed by Duolingo in Pittsburgh working on speech recognition, followed by Meta in NYC working on AR/VR headsets.

item.title: Semester Abroad in Switzerland
item.description: Last modified on: 2022-12-03 The town of Lucerne During the Fall 2021 semester, I studied computer science as an exchange student at the University of Zürich and a special student at ETH Zürich in Switzerland. Here’s how it went. (Most of this content is readapted from my exchange experience report, thanks goes to my friend Elaine for helping me edit this.) Preparing Accepted for a exchange! I applied to UZH through Northeastern’s Global Experience Office.

item.title: Travel
item.description: I've been to a lot of places! Prepare to scroll a bit. United States Boston, MA Chicago, IL Concord, MA Glen Canyon, AZ Las Vegas, NV Los Angeles, CA Lexington, KY Nashville, TN New Haven, CT New York, NY Philadelphia, PA Pittsburgh, PA Portland, ME Providence, RI Salt Lake City, UT San Diego, CA San Francisco, CA Seattle, WA International (Work in Progress) Athens, Greece Barcelona, Spain Beijing, China Budapest, Hungary Cambridge, United Kingdom Geneva, Switzerland Kotor, Montenegro Koper, Slovenia Lugano, Switzerland London, United Kingdom Monaco Munich, Germany Osaka, Japan Paris, France Plitvice Lakes, Croatia Prague, Czech Republic Rome, Italy Shenzhen, China Seoul, South Korea (soon) Singapore (soon) Stockholm, Sweden Tokyo, Japan Venice, Italy Vienna, Austria Zurich, Switzerland

item.title: Thoughts
item.description: My Thoughts Just a collection of thoughts and interesting questions I’ve thought about. If you have answers or an opinion to these, I’d love to start a conversation! Restart Civilization Suppose every human on Earth suddenly disappears except you and the other people at your university or workplace. What is the first thing you and your friends do? In the long-term, how would this event affect race, religion, and politics?

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2021
item.description: Co-op Duels: 2021 Last modified on: 2022-11-25 Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, this is how it went during my sophomore year. Some people opt for one long co-op, some break it up into two (me), and some even three. I interned as a software engineer at MathWorks working on the MATLAB engine, followed by Microsoft working on the Azure cloud computing platform, respectively.

item.title: My First Post!
item.description: I decided to migrate from my old website to a blog on the Hugo engine, since I feel like writing to capture my unconventional college experience. My university friend Josh also gave me some great advice to change to a minimalistic website as I’d get tired of the design less easily.
